summary: The Fair Allocation and Improvement of Regional Fleets Act (FAIR Fleets Act) aims to modernize and improve the distribution of the U.S. Postal Service's fleet vehicles. It mandates an ongoing assessment of fleet distribution and a strategic plan to increase vehicle availability in underserved areas. It also requires the Postal Service to modernize its fleet with fuel-efficient and environmentally friendly vehicles. An annual report to Congress is mandated, detailing fleet distribution, steps taken to improve distribution in underserved areas, and recommendations for further improvements. The bill defines "underserved areas" and specifies criteria for identifying them.
